mdRecord.dcterms:description: This lunette is one of eight along the east end mezzanine that illustrate battle scenes. The view here shows a group of Sac and Fox Indians under the direction of the British firing rifles and aiming bows and arrows at settlers plowing fields outside St. Louis. In the background there is the fort at St. Louis, built near what is now Sixth Street and Franklin Avenue. Smoke from the settlers' cannon is visible coming from the fort, indicating the force with which the settlers defended the fort and won the battle. -- http://collections.si.edu/ [work]
